    • Method Detail

      • formatClassName

        public static java.lang.String formatClassName(java.lang.Class<?> c,
                               java.lang.String regex,
                               java.lang.String combineWith)
        Parameters:
        c - The class to split the name for
        regex - Regex to split the name on. if it is null, the default regex is chosen which is to split on uppercase
        combineWith - The way to combine the split string. If it is null, the default combine is chosen which is an underscore
        Returns:

      • objectAssignableFrom

        public static boolean objectAssignableFrom(java.lang.Class<?> c1,
                           java.lang.Class<?> c2)
        Checks if a class is assignable from another class. Example for memory. The Deleteable interface extends the NoCursor interface. To check if an interface is a NoCursor, objectAssignableFrom(Deleteable.class, NoCursor.class)
        Parameters:
        c1 -
        c2 -
        Returns:

      • canParseInt

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isClassCallable

        public static <T extends DatabaseObject> boolean isClassCallable(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                 java.lang.Class<?> procedureType)
        Checks if a Database Object is able to call the procedureType. This is to make sure that a view and database object can't call each other's procedures if they are not implemented for that class
        Parameters:
        type -
        procedureType -
        Returns:
